body.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Open Hardware Summit","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" is the annual conference organized by the Open Source Hardware Association a 501(c)(3) not for profit charity. It is the worldâ€™s first comprehensive conference on open hardware; a venue and community in which we discuss and draw attention to the rapidly growing Open Source Hardware movement.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Since the 2013 Open Hardware Summit at MIT, Addie Wagenknecht has chaired the Summit and served on the board of the organization.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In 2018 you can expect Eric Von Hippel discussing the economics of open hardware, Sara Chipps on C++ API for kids, Stephanie Valencia talking about creating accessible futures with oshw and Tarek Loubani on making lifesaving medical equipment under fire. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"As well as 13 more speakers presenting on their ohsw work and a lunch time film presentation of R","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"ed Hat and Open Source Stories, latest film: The Science of Collective Discovery, including the premiere of an all new Prologue featuring OSHWA Director and Founder Alicia Gibbs. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}
